channel.title: Trill sensors - New I2C object
channel.description:
Any plan of making an object to read from these [awesome touch sensors](https://bela.io/products/trill/)? It's speaking I2C, and the Arduino library is [here](https://github.com/BelaPlatform/Trill-Arduino).
I have some C/C++ experience, but not sure I'll be able to do it myself... How difficult would you say it is to make it work? Is it worth using parts of the Trill-Arduino code, or better start from scratch? I've seen some posts about good practices for writing a new I2C object, but any advice/link welcome!
Thanks for your time and dedication.
